messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=84c4b83085d1 ***

doc/go1.1.html: introduction

R=golang-dev, adg, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode10 doc/go1.1.html:10: When Go version 1, also known as Go 1 the "also known as" is probably not worth it https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode24 doc/go1.1.html:24: includes some major work on the implementation of the compilers, s/includes some/is/ ? https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode35 doc/go1.1.html:35: although a couple of rare error cases are now caught by the Go 1.1 should we call these out specifically in the intro? we shouldn't force users to read the whole document just to see if they fall into the few minority cases

https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode10 doc/go1.1.html:10: When Go version 1, also known as Go 1 could drop /doc/ if you wanted. same directory. https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode14 doc/go1.1.html:14: and systems around the world. Several "point" releases since then: "i'm trying to use one space after periods, breaking a lifelong habit" https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode16 doc/go1.1.html:16: known bugs and avoided any non-critical changes to the implementation. I've stumbled over this this transition from "primarily to" into "avoided" a couple times. Maybe break it into two sentence: ... have since been issued. The point releases fixed known bugs but avoided any non-critical ... https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/3001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode36 doc/go1.1.html:36: implementation so may need to be addressed if they arise. Details two spaces

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, adg@golang.org, bradfitz@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

LGTM https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/9001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/7696045/diff/9001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode41 doc/go1.1.html:41: 64-bit ints and Unicode literals missing # before unicode_literals
